RelatedSentence: As if the deadly flooding inundating much of the Balkans was n't alarming enough , rescuers must now grapple with another concern : the risk of landmines from the Bosnian war resurfacing , CNN reports .

There are reports that landmines buried during the conflict and not yet removed are in some instances being shifted with the landslides , adding ( to ) the dangers of people living in the areas as well as rescuers , the Red Cross said .

A1: two dozen people in Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina
RelatedSentence: The mammoth flooding has already killed at least two dozen people in Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina .
CNN meteorologist Pedram Javaheri said flooding in the region will last at least another week - and in some places , it could get worse .
As water rushes downstream , the flood level in Belgrade is expected to rise through Thursday , Javaheri said .
In Serbia alone , more than 24,000 people have evacuated to escape water that is chest - high in some areas .
In Serbia alone , more than 24,000 people have evacuated to escape water that is chest - high in some areas .
The Serbian government said at least 12 bodies have been found in the town of Obrenovac , about 35 kilometers ( 22 miles ) from the capital of Belgrade .
But one of the 12 was someone who had already died of natural causes , Serbian Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic said .
One of the deceased was a rescuer , said Dragan Radovanovic , president of the Serbian branch of the Red Cross .
Authorities estimate that 90 % of Obrenovac has been flooded .
The catastrophic weather has prompted authorities to declare a state of emergency in Bosnia and Herzegovina .

The epic flooding is the worst Serbia has seen since the country began keeping records 120 years ago , meteorologists said .
